attributes.action: Government remove failing Academy Trusts after two years of inadequate results
attributes.background:
Academy School Trusts failing children are allowed to continue with no public scrutiny.  Trust are a business model if results are not delivered then changes to who runs the School should be made . 
 Policy should be in place for intervention  at local  government level. Children need our support.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation requiring contractors to warranty repairs on roads
attributes.background:
Potholes are estimated to cost motorists an estimated £730 million every year.

A large percentage of potholes result from utility company and local council works where the restorative works on the road are sub-standard and which often fail prematurely.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of road repairs falls to Local Authorities, who have a legal obligation to keep roads in good repair. If repairs was carried out to a required standard and contractors required by legislation to warranty the repair, then the Local Authorities would have the legal power to hold road repair contractors and utility companies to account, and either claim the cost of subsequent repair from the organisations that undertake the repair, or force them to restore the damage at their cost

attributes.action: Payment terms exceeding 30 days from when an invoice is issued should be illegal
attributes.background: I am the director of a small electrical contracting company. It is about time something was done about the big company's who think it is acceptable to make smaller companies, especially in construction, wait ridiculous amounts of time for payment. Small businesses regularly go bust due to this.
attributes.additional_details: All company's from bottom of the pile to the top should be legally required to pay no later than 30 days from invoice

attributes.action: We demand a referendum for any US-UK trade deal
attributes.background: The deal being stitched up by Present-elect Trump and the UK government could have wide consequences for our public services and the status of the UK with our European neighbours. The effect on the NHS, our education system and a range of public services could be catastrophic for ordinary people.

attributes.action: Landlords must declare mortgage arrears or court proceedings related to property
attributes.background: This petition is to make it law that a landlord must declare whether there are any ongoing court proceedings in relation to the property being let (such as repossession, power of sale etc) and/or any mortgage arrears prior to a tenancy agreement being issued.
attributes.additional_details: In November 2015 I took out a 12 month assured tenancy agreement with no break clause. 4 months into the tenancy it became apparent that our landlord was in mortgage arrears prior to our tenancy, that repossession proceedings had began regarding the property and that a further court case meant that power of sale was provided to a third party to dispose of the property. As tenants we should have been made aware of these issues prior to our tenancy beginning given the complications this creates.

attributes.action: Put a cap on homework for under 17's
attributes.background: The amount of homework is decided by the education minister, who signs acts that will never directly effect him. It has been shown by several studies that excessive amounts of homework can lead to depression, anxiety and even lower grades. I think there should be a cap on homework to prevent this.
attributes.additional_details:
My sources:
https://factualfacts.com/science-facts/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades-studies-suggest/

http://www.mindmake.com/blog/too-much-homework-can-cause-stress-depression-and-lower-grades/

https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/the-squeaky-wheel/201110/how-much-homework-is-too-much

attributes.action: Make individuals' contributions to the DFID International Aid budget voluntary
attributes.background: The international aid budget is out of control and management of it is not fit for purpose since much of it is wasted through ill advised means of spending or just plain poor management by, amongst others, unelected staff with their own agenda. Many UK citizens believe 'charity begins at home'.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing citizens to either 'opt in' or 'opt out' through their annual tax return, HMRC will still be able to collect the tax from those who wish to pay it while allowing others to pay their contribution to their preferred, domestic, budgets. Overall, the actual percentage size of the budget will reflect the proportion of citizens willing to pay for overseas aid.

attributes.action: All HGVs and PCVs on british roads to have driver monitoring technology
attributes.background: Distraction such as mobile phone usage or 'micro sleeping' are major contributing factors to many deaths on British roads. Result can be much worse when in control of a HGV or PCV. Legislation to ensure that these class' of vehicle are fitted with the driver monitoring technology will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-10-31/lorry-driver-who-killed-mother-and-three-children-while-on-mobile-phone-sentenced-for-10-years/

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/aug/04/lorry-driver-danny-warby-found-guilty-crash-death-sharon-garrett-cambridgeshire

http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/drivers/fatigue/road-accidents/

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/tiredness-can-kill-advice-for-drivers


http://www.brake.org.uk/wake-up/15-facts-a-resources/facts/485-driver-tiredness

attributes.action: Preserve current opt-outs should the UK decide to rejoin the EU in the future.
attributes.background: The UK's recent vote to leave the EU saw young people vote overwhelmingly to remain, making it possible that future public opinion will favour rejoining. To make this process smoother we hereby call upon the government to preserve the UK's current opt-outs for potential future membership.
attributes.additional_details: Opt-outs are when EU Member States decide not to participate in European legislation or treaties. As a member since 1973, the UK opted out of both the Euro and the Schengen Agreement on passport-free movement of people. However, countries wishing to join in future may not opt out of such agreements permanently. Therefore, preserving current opt-outs for a future British application to rejoin the EU would make the terms of future membership more favourable.

attributes.action: Change the law on court child access fees
attributes.background: Every time a parent goes against the court order, that parent has to pay £220 to go back to court. It's ridiculous the other parent going against the courts order for access should be charged this fee.
attributes.additional_details: If the parent who went against a court access order was charged the fee or had to re pay the £220 to the aggrieved parent. It's totally wrong that the aggrieved parent has to keep paying this money.  Maybe if the other parent had to pay it, they would not go against court order in the first place.

attributes.action: Get the government to remove stamp duty from buy-to-let property
attributes.background: The btl mortgages have dropped 60% since April when George Osborne brought in the states on btl and 2nd homes. This is damaging the housing market and the rental market for both renters and 1st time buyers

attributes.action: Raise awareness and put more funding into treating and diagnosing VGM.
attributes.background: My little boy was repeatedly failed by numerous of consultants, doctors and hospitals after being diagnosed with Vein of Galen malformation. This was purely due to the lack of knowledge and understanding of the condition. We're counting our lucky stars he finally got treatment before it was too late
attributes.additional_details:
This condition is deadly. A ticking time bomb in your head. It's diagnosed in pregnancy and is where a mass forms in the brain putting strain on the heart to provide this mass with more blood. So many children die because either because it's too late to treat them or because of complications. 
This needs to stop! 
I nearly lost my little boy and I won't sit and watch it happen to any other parent. 
Money needs to be invested in helping doctors diagnose and treat children before it's too late.

attributes.action: Stop Mandatory Overtime for Parents of Disabled and Poorly Children
attributes.background: Quite often parents of disabled and poorly children are expected by their employer to work additional hours above the contracted amount, often at short notice. This expectation, if not met, can to lead to poor performance ratings, missed promotion opportunities and sometimes disciplinary action.
attributes.additional_details: For parents of these children being at home to support their family is paramount. Being forced into mandatory overtime can have a severe impact on the child's development, cause stress within a parents relationship and prevent a strong and robust support network for both the child and parent career. Removing the expectation of overtime and allowing parents to opt out of working any additional hours would eliminate stress, reassure the family and set clear boundaries to the employer.

attributes.action: Make Not Paying Taxi Fare a Crimnal Offence Oppose to a Civil Matter
attributes.background: When a passenger doesnt pay for a taxi ride either refusing or just simply run away and you call the Police, their response is its a civil matter not a criminal offence. Why is it not a criminal offence. The customer has not paid for a service provided by the taxi driver.

attributes.action: Prevent UK government from using Trump Organisation venues, services, products.
attributes.background: Mr D J Trump is President of the USA. He refuses to separate his business holdings from his Office. His interests include hotels, golf clubs and restaurants and enterprises such as office accommodation. He stands personally to profit from U.K. Government/taxpayer spending, which would be corrupt.
attributes.additional_details: Please see the website of the Trump Organisation, as well as extensive recent international press coverage on this problematic issue. There is also a current lawsuit, brought against him for benefiting from the lease of his latest Trump Hotel in Washington, which is a state owned building and where the relevant lease prohibits a federal employee from benefiting from said lease.

attributes.action: Allow Donald trump free access to the UK during his presidency.
attributes.background:
Many people have been asking to ban him ? Why?

People are in outrage over a temporary ban that had been twisted by the media, Obama did this in 2011 where was his ban petition.

Please deny all future ban requests.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Change the legislation regarding the trapping and killing of foxes and wildlife
attributes.background: Currently it is legal to trap foxes and other wildlife in snares and cages and then kill them "humanely." The very act of trapping and killing a wild animal is inhumane and is cruelty at it's best. The law should only allow farmers the right to kill an animal if said animal is causing problems.
attributes.additional_details: Hunters and generally nasty people are using these laws to trap foxes for training their dogs to hunt and kill. Hunting in this country is absolutely pointless and is purely to fulfill a sick ego. If we had bears and predatory animals roaming our streets then hunting would make more sense. The cruelty one can impose on an animal is merely a snapshot into their psyche and gives evidence they are not mentally healthy people who would not think much about inflicting pain on another human.

attributes.action: Make parents who prevent other parents seeing there child liable for court fees
attributes.background: I believe that any parent who prevents the other parent seeing their child/children without a valid reason should be held liable for any court costs, if it goes to court.
attributes.additional_details: Myself and my daughter’s mum split up during the pregnancy. At first everything was fine, despite us no longer being together we still had regular contact regarding the pregnancy. Unfortunately it didn't last and at about 22 weeks into the pregnancy the contact seemed to stop. On numerous occasions I tried making contact with my daughter’s mum but to no avail. I later found out through a 3rd party about my daughter’s birth and despite numerous further attempts, I’ve still had no luck with contact.

attributes.action: Reform the law on the defence of Insanity to benefit the mentally ill
attributes.background:
The Law Commission Report in 2013 recommended a new defence with a special verdict of "not criminally responsible by reason of a recognised medical condition".
Unfortunately this slipped through government policy making and has been ignored since.
attributes.additional_details:
The current law on insanity was made in 1848 when psychaitric illness was hardly understood. 
Despite huge developments in understanding, diagnosis  and treating mental illness, the M'Naughten Rules on insanity have remained unchanged. 
Reintroducing the proposed reform by the Law Commission would mean that people with actual medical conditions won't be excluded by the law and will stop the mentally/physically ill from pleading guilty to avoid the stigma of being classed as insane.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for Students
attributes.background:
In a world where equal opportunity and equality are valued. I see it unfair that millions of students suffering from Mental Disabilities such as ADHD are required to pay for their prescriptions.

Students have limited funds and I feel that those funds should be spent on books, not their medication
attributes.additional_details:
Currently I myself have to pay for my medication, I pay £8.60 for my medication to help treat my ADHD. Paying for the tablets that put them on par with those not suffering from mental disabilities is something that millions of students are facing.
1 in 6 adults have a common mental disorder (CMD), and those of which who are students are occasionally, like myself, facing the choice; food or medication.
This is something I believe should be a thing of the past

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: Change laws on house buying/selling make "accepted offer" legally binding
attributes.background: Currently there is no law or anything legally binding once an offer is accepted, if the buyer pulls out at any time. Which can cause the loss of survey fees and solicitors fees to the buyer. An there is nothing the buyer can do to recoup these costs or any impact on the seller currently.
attributes.additional_details: If this happens a few times this can result in the buyer losing thousands of pounds. A house is one of the biggest expenses and outgoings we incur in our lives. With this uncertainly in can put new buyers off as a house in not guaranteed currently until contracts are completed. An existing home movers off as they just can't take the chance of losing that additional money. Plus the seller and pull out currently with no impact to themselves currently.

attributes.action: Gain funding, raise awareness&reintroduce oral health education back into the UK
attributes.background: I have created this petition to gain support in introducing Oral Health Education back into the UK. As a dental nurse working in the UK I witness the daily effects&trauma that tooth decay in children under the age of 18 causes. I would like to reintroduce OHE into: nurseries,schools&the community.
attributes.additional_details:
Facts and figures:
+ More than 128,000 children under 10 had at least 1 tooth removed since 2011-2016

+ Hospitals are at 'crisis point' for children needing teeth extracted under general anaesthetic

+ £30 million spent on hospital based extractions between 2012-2013 on those aged 18 and under

+ 90% of tooth decay was preventable

+ Dental treatment is FREE for those aged under 18

attributes.action: To create an intermediate tier paper for maths GCSE (all exam boards)
attributes.background: Many students taking the higher tier maths GCSE paper, struggle with the contents, but find the foundation tier too easy. I am petitioning for an 'inbetween paper' that allows students of 'medium ability' to be able to get higher than a grade C at GCSE.

attributes.action: that caravans are only allowed on the public highway between 11pm and 6am.
attributes.background: Caravans are the bane of road users throughout the UK. If they can only travel at night then it will keep the country's roads clear during the day.
attributes.additional_details:
All you have to do is find a slow moving line of traffic in the summer and there will be 1 or 2 monster sized caravans being pulled by some woefully under powered car. To add to it, it will be rammed to the roof with holiday kit.
Get this menace out of the way during the day and keep the traffic moving.

attributes.action: Making the Cervical Cancer Vaccination free on the NHS for women 35 and under.
attributes.background: I recently turned 19 years old, and have discovered that  on the NHS I am no longer eligible to be Vaccinated against Cervical Cancer. Cervical Cancer is the most common type of Cancer in Women under 35, and this Vaccination could change that.
attributes.additional_details: Girls to get Vaccinated in schools, but if a girl was to miss this and then circumstances occurred where she never received it prior to being 18, then she will remain unprotected for the rest of her life.

attributes.action: Introduce animal rights to the primary curriculum
attributes.background: All children need to be educated about sentient beings and how non human animals are capable of having the same senses as us. Every one feels pain,including all non human animals. Everyone feels love,pleasure,joy,loss,fear frustration and depression,including non human animals.
attributes.additional_details: To deny someone of their basic rights of freedom and life is morally wrong. To take away a life for reasons of greed and pleasure, for reasons of gain/profit is morally wrong. We have a moral obligation to teach children that killing all forms of sentient animals is wrong. Children need to have the choices of not wanting to eat,wear,or exploit those who rely on us for protection and defence. Children need to be taught all about the profit making industries who exploit and kill non human animals.

attributes.action: Stop the imposition of 'Relationships Education' on primary school children
attributes.background: The new Clause 15 of the Children and Social Work Bill will allow the Government to impose compulsory 'Relationships Education' on primary school children.  This represents a disgraceful intrusion on private family life and is a direct attack on parental responsibility.

attributes.action: Reduce the 10 years Ban for anyone who has at any stage been illegal in the UK.
attributes.background: A new law that deprives qualified settled residents in the UK of becoming British Citizens was enacted in 2014, which has affected a lot of people and has hindered some people from taking up their dream profession which requires you to hold a British passport. There is currently a 10 years ban
attributes.additional_details: This is a plea to the home office to either reduce the length of ban or allow settled residents who have held their permanent residence for over 12 months naturalize .

attributes.action: Keep EU students fees in line with UK students post-Brexit.
attributes.background: With the uncertainties thrust upon the nation we, the undersigned, call upon the government to reassure EU students that they are welcome and to commit to keeping their fees in line with UK students.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government were to commit to such an action it would be a clear message to the world that the UK is not anti-immigrant and that it welcomes, and values, the diversity and contributions of all people regardless of their nationality.

Additionally, it would show that this government is not going to use people's live as bargaining tools in the upcoming Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Give a life sentence for sexually assaulting a child.
attributes.background: A belief that the criminal justice system can do more to deter child sex offenders. There is universal agreement that there has been a lack of appropriate sentencing handed out to pedophiles in Britain.

attributes.action: Launch an independent inquiry into politician behaviour in the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The EU referendum campaign was beset by lies and misinformation.

We propose to launch an independent inquiry into the behaviour of MPs and MEPs, to hold to account those willing to further their own aims, irrespective of the truth.

attributes.action: Review and reform behavior during debates within the House of Commons.
attributes.background: Many citizens of this country are  appalled by the jeering, cheering, and most unacceptably, laughter that characterizes PMQs and every other debate that takes place in the chamber at The House of Commons. This childish behavior demonstrates a general disinterest in engaging in robust debate.
attributes.additional_details: When the future of this country is being discussed, when welfare cuts that destroy lives and families are being discussed, it is disgusting to see jokes being made and heartily laughed at. General disorder slows the processes of power and disrupts the scrutiny of government. An immediate review and reform of the guidelines of MPs parliamentary behavior should be enacted. Those who cannot behave in a way befitting the seriousness of political discourse should be disciplined.

attributes.action: Stop the scrapping of The Armed Forces Retention Bonus.
attributes.background:
After the publication of the New Employment Model across the armed forces, retention and morale has taken a critical blow.

I urge the government and MOD to rethink its strategy to revoke all commitment bonuses in 2021 in order to prevent further damage.
attributes.additional_details:
JSP 754, Part 2, Chapter 6, Section 2.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/514120/20160330_NEM-Pay16_Booklet_Rev_300316.pdf

attributes.action: Compulsory for UK schools to teach about sexual consent.
attributes.background: In the UK, it's not compulsory for schools to teach anything about sexual consent or healthy relationships, only about the biology of sex. Before teenagers are sexually active, consent education will give them the power to recognise when receiving or inflicting abuse/exploitation/rape.
attributes.additional_details: On average, the age of first intercourse experience is 15.6 years (14.9 for men and 15.9 for women). It seems, the majority of teenagers are sexually active before the legal age. It is for this reason, sexual consent must be taught before the age of 16. Not just our daughters should leave school able to navigate the sexual challenges and choices they’ll face in adulthood but more importantly boys. Schools must become educators and advocates of sex-positivity/healthy consent for both genders.

attributes.action: Make the HPV vaccine programme aimed towards both sexes instead of only females.
attributes.background: The HPV vaccine (the 'jab' females are highly recommended to get before sexual activity) is not only necessary for females but males as well to help prevent anal, throat and penile cancers, as well as over 100 types of HPV diseases.
attributes.additional_details: Males are not encouraged to receive this vaccine before sexual activity based on the logic that if females don't have the HPV infections then males won't receive them through sexual contact. This leaves males who have sex with males vulnerable to the infections as well as ignoring the benefits the injection has to prevent multiple cancers. The NHS has been encouraging this change for years yet no action has been taken, leaving males uneducated in the matter and at risk of major health hazards.

attributes.action: National insurance should pay for old peoples care, not council tax
attributes.background:
Council tax is a blunt tool, not related to income, and therefore ability to pay.
Many councils are in financial trouble, because of the squeeze from government, and inflationary pressures.
Government can redistribute cash to the areas that need it. leaving the councils to deal with local issues

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying/online threats to be recognised as a serious crime.
attributes.background: There are too many people these days taking their own life due to online threats, bullying etc. If you have ever been to the police about online threats they generally will tell you they cannot help and this needs to stop. It needs to be investigated properly, this will lead to lives being saved.
attributes.additional_details:
Online bullying/threats have become a major problem as technology advances, so how many more people need to take their lives before anything changes?

Some facts in the UK about cyber bullying:
There were over 11,000 counselling sessions with young people who talked to Childline about online issues last year
More than 16,000 young people are absent from school due to bullying.
20% of people who experience cyber bullying contemplate suicide, 1 in 10 attempt it.

attributes.action: Terminate the tax free benefits enjoyed by religious institutions.
attributes.background:
Churches, mosques and synagogues don't pay any tax on earnings or land owned, yet they often preach about social responsibility.
To really help the local communities in which they thrive they should give something back in the form of taxes.
attributes.additional_details:
In light of the fact we are rapidly moving toward a more secular society, why should we still be subsidising religion via tax exemption?
The church often takes a political stance during times of crisis. Most recently the humanitarian disaster that is the refugee exodus, has the church not got a moral responsibility to contribute some of its vast wealth? Now lets make it a legal one too.

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britain’s war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: Have a progressive capital gains tax in the U.K for high net worth individuals.
attributes.background: Only wealthy people make large gains on their assets; yet they pay the same as working people earning £11,000 to £43,000 per year; this is obviously unfair and perpetuates inequality. Let's create a fairer society where our taxes don't benefit the wealthy and everyone really pays their fair share.
attributes.additional_details:
The FTSE 100 average yearly gain is 5.4% (Motley Fool UK).  Yet average yearly earning income increases between 2001 and 2016 is just 2.3% (ONS). Clearly a CGT rate of 20% benefits the wealthy.
CGT shouldn't change for companies, only for high net worth individuals. Capital investment is essential to our economy; and individuals won't be put off investing if they have to pay 40% on their profits like everyone else. Changing CGT would improve inequality and provide revenue for the government.

attributes.action: England : have a referendum to leave the U.k. thus leaving the EU automatically
attributes.background:
As the UK is a political entity within the EU. If England would vote to leave the U.K. Then England would automatically become its own country outside the UK and the EU. No article 50 needed. No negotiations beforehand. 

The Scottish referendum made this clear to any country that leaves the U.K.

attributes.action: Create a single Bullying Law that applies to all Schools in England
attributes.background: Schools are letting pupils down by not taking Bullying seriously and ignoring their policies. There needs to be a Law on Bullying that all Schools have to abide by. There are Children taking their own lives and i feel this would stop if there was a law that made schools help.
attributes.additional_details: News Articles. My own experience with my Child. I have spoken to numerous other Parents about their experiences too

attributes.action: Change abortion laws. Abortions should only be up until week 15 no later.
attributes.background: U.K Abortion laws should be reduced to 15 weeks unless a threat to the baby or mothers health. This gives women plenty of time to make up their mind about their choice. Provide more sexual health education instead and provide free contraception to schools and GPs.
attributes.additional_details: Some babies have survived abortions and some babies have been born premature and have survived from as early as week 20 yet our law permits abortion til week 24. Provide better support for women in sexual relations instead with better sexual health education, free contraception and guidance counselling or some sort of help with personal development and relationships. Encourage adoption instead. Fund better antenatal support. Give free counselling support to victims of rape instead.

attributes.action: Change the law on sexual abuse in a position of trust to include sports clubs
attributes.background: I was concerned to find that the Sexual Offences Act 2003 doesn't include sports clubs as one of the settings in which the Act’s provisions on ‘abuse of position of trust’ apply. At the moment, the law doesn't protect 16 and 17 year olds from sexual harassment and abuse in sports clubs.

attributes.action: Change The Legislation Against Certain Dog Breeds In The UK.
attributes.background: This law is an outrage, a dogs actions are influenced by an owner. We do not discriminate against humans by banning certain races, so why can be do this with dogs by breed? I personally have had a Staffordshire Bull Terrier, Pitbull cross. He was perfect, My best friend. Stand Up and Fight This Law!

attributes.action: Create a new law for theft/damage of public access Life saving Equipment
attributes.background: Equipment such as Defibrillators or any lifesaving equipment. At present the law seems to be that they are only covered under simple theft act. We are now seeing more defibrillators in public; some that have been supplied by community fundraising/private donations surely they need more protection?
attributes.additional_details: A recent case; Hinckley where a man stole a defibrillator from a public box whilst a 1 man paramedic was attending to a incident, He has been arrested for theft, there have been other cases around the country. As a first aider & a volunteer responder I feel that a new law with a substantial minimum fine &/Or a prison term for theft/Damage of lifesaving equipment is needed. More public units are available & need to be protected. Potentially someone could die if the equipment is damaged or stolen.
